intro: Onosma bhutanica, commonly known as Bhutan thyme, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Bhutan. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. It is often found in open grasslands and among shrubs in the Himalayan region. Onosma bhutanica is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
